organization.name: Nitrogen Urban Network
organization.mission: Empowering urban communities through sustainable development and environmental justice initiatives.

team.name: Sarah Johnson
team.title: Executive Director
team.bio: 20 years experience in urban development and community organizing.

team.name: Marcus Williams
team.title: Programs Director
team.bio: Specializes in environmental justice and community engagement.

past_programs.name: Green Alleys Initiative
past_programs.description: Transformed 15 urban alleys into green spaces with native plants and sustainable drainage.
past_programs.impact: Reduced flooding by 40% and created 5 new community gathering spaces.

past_programs.name: Youth Urban Farmers
past_programs.description: Trained 50 youth in urban farming techniques and entrepreneurship.
past_programs.impact: Created 3 community gardens that provide fresh produce to 200+ families.

organization.case_for_support: Nitrogen Urban Network addresses the critical issues of environmental inequality and food insecurity in Detroit's underserved neighborhoods. Our holistic approach combines urban agriculture, sustainable infrastructure development, and youth empowerment to create lasting positive change. Through our programs, we've transformed vacant lots into productive gardens, trained youth in valuable skills, and advocated for policies that support environmental justice. Our work not only improves the physical environment but also builds community resilience, creates economic opportunities, and empowers residents to become agents of change in their neighborhoods. With additional support, we can expand our impact to more neighborhoods, reach more youth, and develop innovative solutions to the complex challenges facing urban communities.

grants.title: Community Garden Expansion Initiative
grants.description: Funding to expand community gardens in underserved neighborhoods with a focus on food security and community engagement.
grants.eligibility: Nonprofit organizations working in urban agriculture with at least 3 years of experience.
grants.match_explanation: Strong alignment with urban agriculture focus area and community development goals. Organization has demonstrated success with similar projects through Youth Urban Farmers program.

grants.title: Youth Environmental Leadership Program
grants.description: Support for programs that engage youth in environmental initiatives and develop leadership skills through hands-on projects.
grants.eligibility: Organizations with youth programs focused on environmental education and leadership development.
grants.match_explanation: Excellent match with youth empowerment and environmental education focus. Organization's past success with youth programming is a strong advantage.

grants.title: Sustainable Infrastructure Development Grant
grants.description: Funding for innovative infrastructure projects that address climate resilience, water management, and sustainable development in urban areas.
grants.eligibility: Nonprofit organizations partnering with local government entities on infrastructure projects.
grants.match_explanation: Good alignment with sustainable infrastructure focus, but limited experience with government partnerships may be a challenge.
grants.contact_info: Dr. Amara Johnson, Director of Programs, ajohnson@resilientcities.org

grants.title: Environmental Justice Advocacy Grant
grants.description: Support for advocacy work addressing environmental inequities in disadvantaged communities through policy change, education, and community organization.
grants.eligibility: Organizations with a proven track record in environmental justice advocacy and community organizing.
grants.match_explanation: Exceptional alignment with environmental justice focus area. Organization's mission and past work directly address the grant priorities.
grants.contact_info: Tasha Davis, Senior Program Officer, tdavis@justiceforwardfoundation.org

grants.title: Community Renewable Energy Project
grants.description: Funding for community-based renewable energy projects that provide economic benefits to low-income communities while reducing carbon emissions.
grants.eligibility: Nonprofit organizations working on renewable energy projects with community ownership models.
grants.match_explanation: Moderate alignment with renewable energy focus, but organization has limited technical experience in energy projects.

grants.title: Urban Green Space Development
grants.description: Support for converting vacant lots into functional green spaces that benefit community health, biodiversity, and climate resilience.
grants.eligibility: Community-based organizations with experience in urban green space development.
grants.match_explanation: Strong alignment with urban green space development experience. Green Alleys Initiative demonstrates proven success in similar projects.

grants.title: Community Food Systems Grant
grants.description: Funding to develop and improve local food systems in urban areas with limited access to fresh produce.
grants.eligibility: Organizations working to address food insecurity and develop sustainable food systems.
grants.match_explanation: Good alignment with urban agriculture focus, but proposal needed stronger evaluation metrics.
